KH.content: in Timaeus, Greeks who have no writing (unlike Egyptians), need myth (destined to perpetual childhood) > memory of city, its salvation, entrusted to the writing of the other [who is the master here?]
KH.linkedContent: in Timaeus, Greeks who have no writing (unlike Egyptians), need myth (destined to perpetual childhood) > memory of city, its salvation, entrusted to the writing of the other [who is the master here?]

GT.content: several meanings of vous avez raison: 1) animal rationale (logon ekhon) 2) know how to count, account, principle of reason, we are men of knowledge, good narrators 3) our calculation has prevailed, we have controlled (arraisonné) (the other) by reasoning
GT.linkedContent: several meanings of vous avez raison: 1) animal rationale (logon ekhon) 2) know how to count, account, principle of reason, we are men of knowledge, good narrators 3) our calculation has prevailed, we have controlled (arraisonné) (the other) by reasoning

MONL.content: master does not have exclusive possession of anything, only possesses, usurps unnaturally, rapes, colonizes through “unnatural process of politico-phantasmatic constructions”
MONL.linkedContent: master does not have exclusive possession of anything, only possesses, usurps unnaturally, rapes, colonizes through “unnatural process of politico-phantasmatic constructions”

MONL.content: people must yield to the homo-hegemony of dominant languages, the languages of masters, capital, machine
MONL.linkedContent: people must yield to the homo-hegemony of dominant languages, the languages of masters, capital, machine

MONL.content: political decision in writing & reading: inscribe undecidable (chance, terror) in ipseity of host, avoid temptation to make prior-to-the-first-language a language of the master (new master)
MONL.linkedContent: political decision in writing & reading: inscribe undecidable (chance, terror) in ipseity of host, avoid temptation to make prior-to-the-first-language a language of the master (new master)

H.content: p. anne 28 “thought is in essence a force of mastery…breaking up the unknown to possess it, shed light on it, name it”
H.linkedContent: p. anne 28 “thought is in essence a force of mastery…breaking up the unknown to possess it, shed light on it, name it”

H.content: I want to be master of my house, ipse, to receive whoever I like there
H.linkedContent: I want to be master of my house, ipse, to receive whoever I like there

H.content: master: prisoner of his place and power
H.linkedContent: master: prisoner of his place and power

POO.content: identifiable institutions stabilize, arrest turbulence, master, order, to be able to make decisions, to be able > literature is exemplary in the face of this, it always does something other, something other than itself: for example: philosophy (literature & philosophy)
POO.linkedContent: identifiable institutions stabilize, arrest turbulence, master, order, to be able to make decisions, to be able > literature is exemplary in the face of this, it always does something other, something other than itself: for example: philosophy (literature & philosophy)

SPOM.content: the address “I’m going to teach you to live,” from lips of master, father to son > hesitates btwn address as experience, as education, as taming or training (dressage)
SPOM.linkedContent: the address “I’m going to teach you to live,” from lips of master, father to son > hesitates btwn address as experience, as education, as taming or training (dressage)

SPOM.content: dominant discourse [re: Marxism]: hegemony & “incontestable self-evidence,” testimony, regarding it: 1) public space of testimony: a) political b) mass-media culture c) scholarly, academic culture 2) to speak of dominant “Marxist” discourse is still to speak in Marxist code
SPOM.linkedContent: dominant discourse [re: Marxism]: hegemony & “incontestable self-evidence,” testimony, regarding it: 1) public space of testimony: a) political b) mass-media culture c) scholarly, academic culture 2) to speak of dominant “Marxist” discourse is still to speak in Marxist code

SPOM.content: we can inherit via Marx idea that there’s hegemonic forces represented by dominant rhetoric & ideology w/out supporting his idea of superstructure or (self-)identity of social class
SPOM.linkedContent: we can inherit via Marx idea that there’s hegemonic forces represented by dominant rhetoric & ideology w/out supporting his idea of superstructure or (self-)identity of social class

POR.content: principle of reason (Satz vom Grund) tells us to protect [dominant] relation of ob-ject before a subject that says “I”, and is assured of presence
POR.linkedContent: principle of reason (Satz vom Grund) tells us to protect [dominant] relation of ob-ject before a subject that says “I”, and is assured of presence

POR.content: Heidegger’s caricature of principle of reason: hard, unblinking eyes (dominating, raping)
POR.linkedContent: Heidegger’s caricature of principle of reason: hard, unblinking eyes (dominating, raping)

POR.content: for Heidegger, principle of reason depends on delivery (Zustellung) of atomic energy > all Stellen (Vorstellen, Nachstellen…) characterize information tactics of modern technology
POR.linkedContent: for Heidegger, principle of reason depends on delivery (Zustellung) of atomic energy > all Stellen (Vorstellen, Nachstellen…) characterize information tactics of modern technology

POR.content: information most economic, clearest, fastest, instructs men about safeguarding (Sicherstellung) their needs, ta khreai > computers, data banks, constructed on basis of this calculable language: all this, via Heidegger, assures man’s mastery over earth [Derrida can’t elaborate on this point]
POR.linkedContent: information most economic, clearest, fastest, instructs men about safeguarding (Sicherstellung) their needs, ta khreai > computers, data banks, constructed on basis of this calculable language: all this, via Heidegger, assures man’s mastery over earth [Derrida can’t elaborate on this point]

MPM.content: de Man: against Schlegel, Hegel on irony’s mastery, way it rises above finite determinations
MPM.linkedContent: de Man: against Schlegel, Hegel on irony’s mastery, way it rises above finite determinations

EM.content: interest in universality of anthropos a sign of West’s attempt to interiorize, master what’s different from it, l’effet de cette différence d’un tout autre ordre, where philosophical colloquium has no meaning, this other space neither barren, nor desert-like
EM.linkedContent: interest in universality of anthropos a sign of West’s attempt to interiorize, master what’s different from it, l’effet de cette différence d’un tout autre ordre, where philosophical colloquium has no meaning, this other space neither barren, nor desert-like

PP.content: “no absolute privilege allows us absolutely to master its textual system [re: use of pharmakon in Plato]”
PP.linkedContent: “no absolute privilege allows us absolutely to master its textual system [re: use of pharmakon in Plato]”

PP.content: the “drug” side of pharmakon creates surprises for those who try to manipulate it as master/subject
PP.linkedContent: the “drug” side of pharmakon creates surprises for those who try to manipulate it as master/subject

PP.content: Isocrates: sophists should pay since they are in need of such help from masters of logos
PP.linkedContent: Isocrates: sophists should pay since they are in need of such help from masters of logos

PP.content: “Platonism” rehearses “family scene” while also trying to master it, to conceal (dissimuler) it by drawing curtains over the dawning of the West
PP.linkedContent: “Platonism” rehearses “family scene” while also trying to master it, to conceal (dissimuler) it by drawing curtains over the dawning of the West

PP.content: transmission of dialectical mastery of pharmaka from father to son disrupted by family scene that constitutes & undermines passage btwn pharmacy & house
PP.linkedContent: transmission of dialectical mastery of pharmaka from father to son disrupted by family scene that constitutes & undermines passage btwn pharmacy & house

VM.content: following Levinas, what would a language w/out phrase offer the other? a master who forbids himself the phrase gives nothing, has no disciples, only slaves
VM.linkedContent: following Levinas, what would a language w/out phrase offer the other? a master who forbids himself the phrase gives nothing, has no disciples, only slaves

PAS.content: female voice in Pas wonders if Derrida [?] will show economical mastery, render himself untranslatable in the proposal (propos)
PAS.linkedContent: female voice in Pas wonders if Derrida [?] will show economical mastery, render himself untranslatable in the proposal (propos)

PAS.content: certitude, mastery, puts limits on madness, uses Witz, this slavish, economic vulgarity (of our epoch), masters what occurs in blank spaces [btwn 2 pas], condenses d’avance (in advance)
PAS.linkedContent: certitude, mastery, puts limits on madness, uses Witz, this slavish, economic vulgarity (of our epoch), masters what occurs in blank spaces [btwn 2 pas], condenses d’avance (in advance)

PAS.content: psychoanalysis already warned us, Witz always denies relation to other, always apotropaic
PAS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis already warned us, Witz always denies relation to other, always apotropaic

PAS.content: Blanchot unleashes what Witz contains or denies, a transparent, neutral, impassive surface of language of writing, beyond/before les lignes de rupture ou de front (psychoanalysis, literature, philosophy, political practice/thought)
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot unleashes what Witz contains or denies, a transparent, neutral, impassive surface of language of writing, beyond/before les lignes de rupture ou de front (psychoanalysis, literature, philosophy, political practice/thought)

PAS.content: Derrida would praise him for this if that were not another kind of mastery
PAS.linkedContent: Derrida would praise him for this if that were not another kind of mastery

PAS.content: mastery, getting by too well, je m’en tirais trop bien, does not allow chance of event, must be disabled, wrecked, for something other to happen finally: the best & worst > la dérive [Blanchot’s] guards against security, anchorage, property and against, perhaps, ce qui arrive, le pire ou le meilleur, venant d’en face ou de l’abîme [?]
PAS.linkedContent: mastery, getting by too well, je m’en tirais trop bien, does not allow chance of event, must be disabled, wrecked, for something other to happen finally: the best & worst > la dérive [Blanchot’s] guards against security, anchorage, property and against, perhaps, ce qui arrive, le pire ou le meilleur, venant d’en face ou de l’abîme [?]

PAS.content: Derrida questions himself about whether he hides a new economy, new mastery behind the undecidable > [responds] nothing that doesn’t expose itself & remove itself
PAS.linkedContent: Derrida questions himself about whether he hides a new economy, new mastery behind the undecidable > [responds] nothing that doesn’t expose itself & remove itself

PAS.content: assimilating interiority of mastery can also be terrible thus compulsion toward outside could be defense > sauf le dehors, tout sauf le dehors
PAS.linkedContent: assimilating interiority of mastery can also be terrible thus compulsion toward outside could be defense > sauf le dehors, tout sauf le dehors

PAS.content: diabolical duplicity works with mastery in mind, lays traps in labyrinth, sees staircase as a space to lay traps, not as spacing of its very own pas?
PAS.linkedContent: diabolical duplicity works with mastery in mind, lays traps in labyrinth, sees staircase as a space to lay traps, not as spacing of its very own pas?

VP.content: “ideality is the salvation or mastery of presence in repetition” (this is why Husserl claims intuition is not reell), not a presence of anything that exists in the world, in correlation w/ ideal acts of repetition [idealization secured by a certain relation of “existent” to his death]
VP.linkedContent: “ideality is the salvation or mastery of presence in repetition” (this is why Husserl claims intuition is not reell), not a presence of anything that exists in the world, in correlation w/ ideal acts of repetition [idealization secured by a certain relation of “existent” to his death]

VP.content: the complicity of idealization and the voice are unfailing: brings monstration [?] to completion; unity of phonē and technē, voice as technical mastery of the object, via objectivity of object > the ideal object can be repeated, to infinity, while remaining the same
VP.linkedContent: the complicity of idealization and the voice are unfailing: brings monstration [?] to completion; unity of phonē and technē, voice as technical mastery of the object, via objectivity of object > the ideal object can be repeated, to infinity, while remaining the same

VP.content: voice’s immediate erasure, its diaphaneity, makes phoneme most ideal of signs
VP.linkedContent: voice’s immediate erasure, its diaphaneity, makes phoneme most ideal of signs

VP.content: phoneme gives itself as mastered ideality of the phenomenon
VP.linkedContent: phoneme gives itself as mastered ideality of the phenomenon

OH.content: every history, history of a culture, has a telos (promise, memory) toward which it dreams of gathering itself > anticipation & telos; and every history cannot be identified in advance, unanticipatable, non-masterable, that of which one has no memory
OH.linkedContent: every history, history of a culture, has a telos (promise, memory) toward which it dreams of gathering itself > anticipation & telos; and every history cannot be identified in advance, unanticipatable, non-masterable, that of which one has no memory

FSW.content: repression of writing, the writing interior to speech contained outside it, repression of that which threatens presence > mastering of absence
FSW.linkedContent: repression of writing, the writing interior to speech contained outside it, repression of that which threatens presence > mastering of absence

TC.content: no project of mastery will have leveled theater of cruelty in advance
TC.linkedContent: no project of mastery will have leveled theater of cruelty in advance

T.content: philosophy and mastery of the limit, relever
resistance to deconstruction: infinite mastery > assurance of Being & interiorization of every limit as being, as its own proper
T.linkedContent: resistance to deconstruction: infinite mastery > assurance of Being & interiorization of every limit as being, as its own proper

T.content: two types of mastery (phallocentrism, logocentrism): 1) hierarchy [Aristotle, Descartes, Kant, Husserl, Heidegger] 2) envelopment [Spinoza, Leibniz, Hegel] (whole in each part), system, encyclopedia, circle, homogeny
T.linkedContent: two types of mastery (phallocentrism, logocentrism): 1) hierarchy [Aristotle, Descartes, Kant, Husserl, Heidegger] 2) envelopment [Spinoza, Leibniz, Hegel] (whole in each part), system, encyclopedia, circle, homogeny

T.content: as long as the tympanum of philosophical mastery is not destroyed, all liberties (denegation, precipitation, ignorance, or stupidity) one takes w/ philosophical order will remain activated a tergo by misconstrued philosophical machines > called back to order
T.linkedContent: as long as the tympanum of philosophical mastery is not destroyed, all liberties (denegation, precipitation, ignorance, or stupidity) one takes w/ philosophical order will remain activated a tergo by misconstrued philosophical machines > called back to order

FWT.content: treatment of animal: logocentrism > proffered the discourse of hegemony: of mastery
FWT.linkedContent: treatment of animal: logocentrism > proffered the discourse of hegemony: of mastery

FWT.content: is Bataille’s sovereignty still theologico-political like Hegel’s mastery? > both are sacrificial
FWT.linkedContent: is Bataille’s sovereignty still theologico-political like Hegel’s mastery? > both are sacrificial

WM.content: concept of concept cannot not retain gesture of mastery
WM.linkedContent: concept of concept cannot not retain gesture of mastery

DS.content: critical desire, philosophical desire, tries to regain mastery, reads hymen acc. this or that species of presence
DS.linkedContent: critical desire, philosophical desire, tries to regain mastery, reads hymen acc. this or that species of presence

OS.content: only presence is mastered, trace (is) that which eludes mastery
OS.linkedContent: only presence is mastered, trace (is) that which eludes mastery

P.content: reserve, savings, stock: self-protection of the work (ergon), binding (Verbindung) of energy, condition for “mastery” of pleasure-principle
P.linkedContent: reserve, savings, stock: self-protection of the work (ergon), binding (Verbindung) of energy, condition for “mastery” of pleasure-principle

P.content: le se-protéger-de-oeuvre (ergon), énergie captée, bordée, condition for mastery of PP, self-protection of energeia > energeia not as pure, total presence (prime mover), but as (par)ergon against what’s lacking in it, lack not as a substantial emptiness, but as impossibility of arresting differance in its contour, in a pose, of localizing lack, like metaphysics does, in its proper place: castration as truth > whether parergon borders (works against) free energy or essential lack, the 2 determinations sont le même (métaphysique)
P.linkedContent: le se-protéger-de-oeuvre (ergon), énergie captée, bordée, condition for mastery of PP, self-protection of energeia > energeia not as pure, total presence (prime mover), but as (par)ergon against what’s lacking in it, lack not as a substantial emptiness, but as impossibility of arresting differance in its contour, in a pose, of localizing lack, like metaphysics does, in its proper place: castration as truth > whether parergon borders (works against) free energy or essential lack, the 2 determinations sont le même (métaphysique)

P.content: acc. Kant, pleasure of knowing (which once existed in a time immemorial [absolute past in a Critique?]), a pleasure of the same—mastery of dissimilar, reduction of heterogenous
P.linkedContent: acc. Kant, pleasure of knowing (which once existed in a time immemorial [absolute past in a Critique?]), a pleasure of the same—mastery of dissimilar, reduction of heterogenous

POS.content: to risk meaning nothing is to start to play, enter play of differance which prevents any word, any concept, from summarizing or governing from a theological presence, centralizing the movement and spacing of differences
POS.linkedContent: to risk meaning nothing is to start to play, enter play of differance which prevents any word, any concept, from summarizing or governing from a theological presence, centralizing the movement and spacing of differences

POS.content: cannot expect “efficacity” of theory/praxis of deconstruction to be immediate, deferred acc. complex networks > regional “effects” of this trembling have a nonregional opening [to the, in the, “general text” (which is neither a reflection nor an effect)] > no pretention to mastery
POS.linkedContent: cannot expect “efficacity” of theory/praxis of deconstruction to be immediate, deferred acc. complex networks > regional “effects” of this trembling have a nonregional opening [to the, in the, “general text” (which is neither a reflection nor an effect)] > no pretention to mastery

POS.content: Marx definitively criticizes use of master-words in German Ideology
POS.linkedContent: Marx definitively criticizes use of master-words in German Ideology

ROP.content: acc. Foucault, that which has already been mastered can no longer be mastered
ROP.linkedContent: acc. Foucault, that which has already been mastered can no longer be mastered

ROP.content: what happens when you apply chiasmatic invagination of borders to analysis? to its phallogocentrism (dominance of master)? > can psychoanalysis belong to anyone, anymore?
ROP.linkedContent: what happens when you apply chiasmatic invagination of borders to analysis? to its phallogocentrism (dominance of master)? > can psychoanalysis belong to anyone, anymore?

ROP.content: Derrida concludes by putting words (modestly) into Foucault’s dead mouth: il aurait renvoyé dos à dos la maîtrise et la mort, c’est-à-dire le même, la mort comme le maître
ROP.linkedContent: Derrida concludes by putting words (modestly) into Foucault’s dead mouth: il aurait renvoyé dos à dos la maîtrise et la mort, c’est-à-dire le même, la mort comme le maître

ATIA.content: staring at his cat, Derrida wonders if this is the same abyss, same vertigo, as when God waited for Adam to name the animals, this awful tale of Genesis, who was born first, before the names? who has remained the despot?
ATIA.linkedContent: staring at his cat, Derrida wonders if this is the same abyss, same vertigo, as when God waited for Adam to name the animals, this awful tale of Genesis, who was born first, before the names? who has remained the despot?

ATIA.content: for Kant, “dignity” of man, his autonomy, his autotely, his capacity for moral autodestination (Selbstbestimmung), for moral autobiography > this is his privilege, assures Herrschaft
ATIA.linkedContent: for Kant, “dignity” of man, his autonomy, his autotely, his capacity for moral autodestination (Selbstbestimmung), for moral autobiography > this is his privilege, assures Herrschaft

ATIA.content: Lacan designates castration complex as Freud’s scientific (nonmythological) original sin (being subjected to the signifier, a nonmastery that gives human mastery over animals)
ATIA.linkedContent: Lacan designates castration complex as Freud’s scientific (nonmythological) original sin (being subjected to the signifier, a nonmastery that gives human mastery over animals)

ATIA.content: divinanimality, quasi-transcendental referent, sacrificed/disavowed foundation of what it founds: justice, symbolic, human order [brings Levinas & Lacan close] > difficulty of uttering discourse of transcendence/mastery e: animal in the name of God/Law
ATIA.linkedContent: divinanimality, quasi-transcendental referent, sacrificed/disavowed foundation of what it founds: justice, symbolic, human order [brings Levinas & Lacan close] > difficulty of uttering discourse of transcendence/mastery e: animal in the name of God/Law

ATIA.content: no human, no animal, no God has mastery over erasure of trace, nor power to “judge” its erasure
ATIA.linkedContent: no human, no animal, no God has mastery over erasure of trace, nor power to “judge” its erasure

DIF.content: the capital “a” of differance, a pyramid [A]; Hegel: body of sign is Egyptian pyramid > Derrida moves from pyramid to tomb, oikēsis > tomb of proper, familial residence, economy of death (this stone announces death of tyrant [cf. TN.]) [this tomb can’t even be made to resonate]
DIF.linkedContent: the capital “a” of differance, a pyramid [A]; Hegel: body of sign is Egyptian pyramid > Derrida moves from pyramid to tomb, oikēsis > tomb of proper, familial residence, economy of death (this stone announces death of tyrant [cf. TN.]) [this tomb can’t even be made to resonate]

DIF.content: strategically differance seemed most proper one [?] to think/master, though maintained w/in structural limits of mastery
DIF.linkedContent: strategically differance seemed most proper one [?] to think/master, though maintained w/in structural limits of mastery

DIF.content: to know there’s nothing kerygmatic [not a master-name] about differance, we must perceive its decapita(liza)tion > must put into question the name of the name
DIF.linkedContent: to know there’s nothing kerygmatic [not a master-name] about differance, we must perceive its decapita(liza)tion > must put into question the name of the name

O.content: no speculative dialectic of same and other can master “difference” (economy of mark-erasure, trace) because such dialectic always remains an operation of mastery
O.linkedContent: no speculative dialectic of same and other can master “difference” (economy of mark-erasure, trace) because such dialectic always remains an operation of mastery

O.content: neither formalism nor thematism can master irremediable structure of gap btwn empty form/full meaning: will miss it in attempt to master it
O.linkedContent: neither formalism nor thematism can master irremediable structure of gap btwn empty form/full meaning: will miss it in attempt to master it

DPi.content: alleged mastery over limit btwn life/death organizes every calculation btwn dead & living, presupposes ability of giving death, mastering instant of death; calculable credit we grant to “death” indexed to set of presuppositions in which “capital punishment” finds a place of inscription where it’s indissociable from murder & suicide; if we can’t master instant of death, one could neither talk of murder, suicide, DP…
DPi.linkedContent: alleged mastery over limit btwn life/death organizes every calculation btwn dead & living, presupposes ability of giving death, mastering instant of death; calculable credit we grant to “death” indexed to set of presuppositions in which “capital punishment” finds a place of inscription where it’s indissociable from murder & suicide; if we can’t master instant of death, one could neither talk of murder, suicide, DP…

DPi.content: DP masters future through machines, or purports to, deprives me of my own finitude, exonerates me of my experience of finitude > thus the seductive fascination it exerts on side of condemning power and side of condemned > fascinated by power of calculation, end of finitude, end of of anxiety, protects against irruption of other > all this decidability remains phantasms > origin of phantasms in general—and perhaps of religion
DPi.linkedContent: DP masters future through machines, or purports to, deprives me of my own finitude, exonerates me of my experience of finitude > thus the seductive fascination it exerts on side of condemning power and side of condemned > fascinated by power of calculation, end of finitude, end of of anxiety, protects against irruption of other > all this decidability remains phantasms > origin of phantasms in general—and perhaps of religion

CHM.content: re: his relation to Foucault: interminable unhappiness (unhappy consciousness) of disciple > master might be absent
CHM.linkedContent: re: his relation to Foucault: interminable unhappiness (unhappy consciousness) of disciple > master might be absent

CHM.content: must break the mirror, the glass, infinite speculation on master: start to speak
CHM.linkedContent: must break the mirror, the glass, infinite speculation on master: start to speak

RGE.content: Lordship’s putting at stake of life (mettre en jeu, Daransetzen des Lebens) has meaning, it’s a moment in constitution of meaning, presentation of essence, truth
RGE.linkedContent: Lordship’s putting at stake of life (mettre en jeu, Daransetzen des Lebens) has meaning, it’s a moment in constitution of meaning, presentation of essence, truth

RGE.content: for history (that is, meaning) to form a continuous chain, to be woven (se trame), master must experience his truth (éprouve sa vérité) (must stay alive once raised above life)
RGE.linkedContent: for history (that is, meaning) to form a continuous chain, to be woven (se trame), master must experience his truth (éprouve sa vérité) (must stay alive once raised above life)

RGE.content: servile condition of mastery & entire history it makes possible > absolute privilege given to slave, truth of the master is the slave: deferred pleasure, limited stakes, delaying disappearance of thing (labor) > the condition of history/meaning/philosophy/discourse
RGE.linkedContent: servile condition of mastery & entire history it makes possible > absolute privilege given to slave, truth of the master is the slave: deferred pleasure, limited stakes, delaying disappearance of thing (labor) > the condition of history/meaning/philosophy/discourse

Gii.content: since, for Heidegger, essence of hand is not in its prehension, it’s also not in Hegelian grasping of Begriff, taking hold by mastery/manipulation > what is hand’s essence?: the gift, give w/out taking anything
Gii.linkedContent: since, for Heidegger, essence of hand is not in its prehension, it’s also not in Hegelian grasping of Begriff, taking hold by mastery/manipulation > what is hand’s essence?: the gift, give w/out taking anything

PIO.content: Leibniz, modern politics of invention: master the aleatory
PIO.linkedContent: Leibniz, modern politics of invention: master the aleatory

RM.content: for Heidegger, Metasprache and Sputnik are the same, monstrous project of father, of metaphysics (mastery of form for form’s sake)
RM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, Metasprache and Sputnik are the same, monstrous project of father, of metaphysics (mastery of form for form’s sake)

TR.content: paradoxical antinomy of performative & event, the former neutralizes event in “I can” of mastery: vulnerability/finitude of body & corpus is limit of performative power
TR.linkedContent: paradoxical antinomy of performative & event, the former neutralizes event in “I can” of mastery: vulnerability/finitude of body & corpus is limit of performative power

WAP.content: by naturalizing [the classroom] one neutralizes, conceals (dissimule), an active machinery, the structures, constraints, forms, settings (cadres), the parergonal, by which the dominating mastery, not neutral at all, centers itself: il n'y a pas de place neutre ou naturelle dans l’enseignement
WAP.linkedContent: by naturalizing [the classroom] one neutralizes, conceals (dissimule), an active machinery, the structures, constraints, forms, settings (cadres), the parergonal, by which the dominating mastery, not neutral at all, centers itself: il n'y a pas de place neutre ou naturelle dans l’enseignement

WAP.content: not so easy to say domination, mastery, is politico-economic—philosophical language can remain hegemonic, even when other forms of domination beat a retreat (battent en retraite)
WAP.linkedContent: not so easy to say domination, mastery, is politico-economic—philosophical language can remain hegemonic, even when other forms of domination beat a retreat (battent en retraite)

WAP.content: hegemonic belatedness (retard-hégémonique): [presence, glory, of the empire after its demise?]
WAP.linkedContent: hegemonic belatedness (retard-hégémonique): [presence, glory, of the empire after its demise?]

AFR.content: [re: Condillac’s ambiguity of 2 imaginations] major strategic operation of mastery is to control ambiguity & risks, the strategy is almost mastery itself
AFR.linkedContent: [re: Condillac’s ambiguity of 2 imaginations] major strategic operation of mastery is to control ambiguity & risks, the strategy is almost mastery itself

AFR.content: mastery, if there is any, does not exist: it must possess what is not, never itself
AFR.linkedContent: mastery, if there is any, does not exist: it must possess what is not, never itself

AFR.content: Condillac’s move from perception to imagination (and from one sign to another): on the march toward freedom, spontaneity of auto-affection > teleology: the complete sign, the true sign, is the instituted sign [after rupture, process magnetized toward greatest mastery possible]
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac’s move from perception to imagination (and from one sign to another): on the march toward freedom, spontaneity of auto-affection > teleology: the complete sign, the true sign, is the instituted sign [after rupture, process magnetized toward greatest mastery possible]

AFR.content: mastery is the institution of arbitrary signs entirely at our disposal or control
AFR.linkedContent: mastery is the institution of arbitrary signs entirely at our disposal or control

PSSS.content: death drive (Todestrieb), cruel drive of destruction, annihilation, but also cruelty in Bemächtigungstrieb (drive for power, sovereignty, mastery)
PSSS.linkedContent: death drive (Todestrieb), cruel drive of destruction, annihilation, but also cruelty in Bemächtigungstrieb (drive for power, sovereignty, mastery)

PSSS.content: mastery, sovereignty (Herrschaft, Bemächtigung), linked to a drive for power, possession, an “I can,” a performative power (Bemächtigungstrieb), via sworn faith (organizes Lacan’s symbolic), indissociable from Bewältigung (exercise of power, movement of appropriation)
PSSS.linkedContent: mastery, sovereignty (Herrschaft, Bemächtigung), linked to a drive for power, possession, an “I can,” a performative power (Bemächtigungstrieb), via sworn faith (organizes Lacan’s symbolic), indissociable from Bewältigung (exercise of power, movement of appropriation)

PSSS.content: “I can,” “I may,” mastery of performative, dominates/neutralizes (in order of “symbolic,” symbolically) the event it produces
PSSS.linkedContent: “I can,” “I may,” mastery of performative, dominates/neutralizes (in order of “symbolic,” symbolically) the event it produces

D.content: column is not, passage of dissemination, “phallic” significance of column is a semic effect, reflection on 4th surface (described center, represented mastery of dissemination); “is”—procures calm, consciousness of ideal mastery > operation of 4th surface
D.linkedContent: column is not, passage of dissemination, “phallic” significance of column is a semic effect, reflection on 4th surface (described center, represented mastery of dissemination); “is”—procures calm, consciousness of ideal mastery > operation of 4th surface

D.content: column has no being, belongs to no one
D.linkedContent: column has no being, belongs to no one

C.content: contingent can do w/out discourse, a masterpiece can’t do w/out a cartouche (on the market & in itself: if you insist on this distinction) > even when the cartouche remains, is defunct: pas de cartouche, plus de cartouche > what will have been able to do w/out it? never touched, aussi impassible et invulnérable qu’aux harcèlements du trait: c’est peut-être qu’il était déjà dans la tombe, le cartouche
C.linkedContent: contingent can do w/out discourse, a masterpiece can’t do w/out a cartouche (on the market & in itself: if you insist on this distinction) > even when the cartouche remains, is defunct: pas de cartouche, plus de cartouche > what will have been able to do w/out it? never touched, aussi impassible et invulnérable qu’aux harcèlements du trait: c’est peut-être qu’il était déjà dans la tombe, le cartouche

LI.content: iterability at once condition/limit of mastery: entame it
LI.linkedContent: iterability at once condition/limit of mastery: entame it

LI.content: Derrida’s uneasiness about using words “force” and “power” [eg. Foucault’s micropowers]—he has 3 conditions for using them: 1) no power/force, only differences of power/force (like Nietzsche) 2) realize the greater force could be the “lesser” 3) account for fact that force/power quickly trapped in ruses of mastery
LI.linkedContent: Derrida’s uneasiness about using words “force” and “power” [eg. Foucault’s micropowers]—he has 3 conditions for using them: 1) no power/force, only differences of power/force (like Nietzsche) 2) realize the greater force could be the “lesser” 3) account for fact that force/power quickly trapped in ruses of mastery

ATM.content: the trap of obeying Levinas in restituting nothing, one becomes deaf to his obligation, but it only feels like a trap when inclined toward mastery, when one pretends to escape from absolute dissymmetry
ATM.linkedContent: the trap of obeying Levinas in restituting nothing, one becomes deaf to his obligation, but it only feels like a trap when inclined toward mastery, when one pretends to escape from absolute dissymmetry

E.content: the ultimately disgusting is unrepresentable, l’exclu absolu, if one could name or represent it, it could enter auto-affective circle of master/reappropriation > must be insensible too (unnameable, un-intelligible), the absolute other of the system [Derrida compares this structure to that of the colossal]
E.linkedContent: the ultimately disgusting is unrepresentable, l’exclu absolu, if one could name or represent it, it could enter auto-affective circle of master/reappropriation > must be insensible too (unnameable, un-intelligible), the absolute other of the system [Derrida compares this structure to that of the colossal]

AD.content: via Benveniste, hosti-pet-s: links hospitality & ipseity, like 2 sovereign powers > “guest-master”
AD.linkedContent: via Benveniste, hosti-pet-s: links hospitality & ipseity, like 2 sovereign powers > “guest-master”

AD.content: hospitality (feminine par excellence) that precedes property can’t be appropriated, arrives before the master
AD.linkedContent: hospitality (feminine par excellence) that precedes property can’t be appropriated, arrives before the master

BSi.content: for Freud, thanks to technology, mastery over nature, man has become a “prosthetic God”
BSi.linkedContent: for Freud, thanks to technology, mastery over nature, man has become a “prosthetic God”

BSi.content: master-self, sovereignty (positionality of self: thesis), ipsissimus (the absolutely himself)
sovereignty, in minimal, strict sense, always a moment of dictatorship: a performative verdict, a Diktat, has no account to render other than to itself (ipse)
BSi.linkedContent: sovereignty, in minimal, strict sense, always a moment of dictatorship: a performative verdict, a Diktat, has no account to render other than to itself (ipse)

BSi.content: Benveniste: dem-pot(i)-[skr.], “master of house,” power of oneself [ipse as sovereignty]
BSi.linkedContent: Benveniste: dem-pot(i)-[skr.], “master of house,” power of oneself [ipse as sovereignty]

BSi.content: Valéry [in Monsieur Teste] tries to neutralize/master Unheimlichkeit [see BSi pp. 200-01 in CAP(ITAL)]
BSi.linkedContent: Valéry [in Monsieur Teste] tries to neutralize/master Unheimlichkeit [see BSi pp. 200-01 in CAP(ITAL)]

BSi.content: zoos profitable to knowledge and economy [physiocratic theory of economy]
nomos of oikos: taming, training, the domus of the dominus > oikonomia also general condition of ipseity as sovereign mastery over beast
BSi.linkedContent: nomos of oikos: taming, training, the domus of the dominus > oikonomia also general condition of ipseity as sovereign mastery over beast

BSi.content: Heidegger asks how logos became Herrschaft (sovereign, master) over Being
BSi.linkedContent: Heidegger asks how logos became Herrschaft (sovereign, master) over Being

OG.content: ontotheology of logos (par excellence w/ Hegel): powerless, oneiric effort to master absence by reducing the metaphor w/in absolute parousia of sense/meaning (sens)
OG.linkedContent: ontotheology of logos (par excellence w/ Hegel): powerless, oneiric effort to master absence by reducing the metaphor w/in absolute parousia of sense/meaning (sens)

OG.content: ethics of speech: delusion of presence mastered

auto-affection, universal structure of experience, being capable of being affected by other, capable of symbolizing, another name for “life,” the as-for-itself or for-itself: subjectivity—gains in its mastery of the other to the extent that its power of repetition idealizes itself (s’idéalise) > the external, the signifier, becomes my spontaneity, and escapes me less and less
OG.linkedContent: auto-affection, universal structure of experience, being capable of being affected by other, capable of symbolizing, another name for “life,” the as-for-itself or for-itself: subjectivity—gains in its mastery of the other to the extent that its power of repetition idealizes itself (s’idéalise) > the external, the signifier, becomes my spontaneity, and escapes me less and less

OG.content: phonic auto-affection permits the epoch of man, epoch not of history but as history: greatest possible mastery, liberty, self-presence of life
OG.linkedContent: phonic auto-affection permits the epoch of man, epoch not of history but as history: greatest possible mastery, liberty, self-presence of life

OG.content: [in spite of Hegel’s follies, Derrida here affirms that concept of history is a concept of philosophy, that history is the history of philosophy]
OG.linkedContent: [in spite of Hegel’s follies, Derrida here affirms that concept of history is a concept of philosophy, that history is the history of philosophy]

UWC.content: necessary to dissociate unconditional independence (of thought, deconstruction, Humanities, justice) from any phantasm of indivisible sovereignty (mastery)
UWC.linkedContent: necessary to dissociate unconditional independence (of thought, deconstruction, Humanities, justice) from any phantasm of indivisible sovereignty (mastery)

SPEC.content: mastery of PP [grand (-père) spéculateur], mastery in general, Herrschaft distanced from PP only to reappropriate itself: tauto-teleology makes other return in domestic specter
SPEC.linkedContent: mastery of PP [grand (-père) spéculateur], mastery in general, Herrschaft distanced from PP only to reappropriate itself: tauto-teleology makes other return in domestic specter

SPEC.content: death drive, w/out contradicting PP, hollows it out, older, not an other mastery (Herrschaft), but other than master, tout autre (not dialectically opposed to PP as life, living, alive)
SPEC.linkedContent: death drive, w/out contradicting PP, hollows it out, older, not an other mastery (Herrschaft), but other than master, tout autre (not dialectically opposed to PP as life, living, alive)

SPEC.content: drive for mastery (Bemächtigungstrieb), beyond PP [?], plays a strangely erased role (what’s the difference btwn a drive and a principle?)
SPEC.linkedContent: drive for mastery (Bemächtigungstrieb), beyond PP [?], plays a strangely erased role (what’s the difference btwn a drive and a principle?)

SPEC.content: PP as author or as authority, it/he only increased by dissidents speaking against it
SPEC.linkedContent: PP as author or as authority, it/he only increased by dissidents speaking against it

SPEC.content: PP loses mastery w/ flooding (Überschwemmung), psychic apparatus no longer seeks pleasure, occupied only w/ binding (binden) excitations, w/ “mastering (bewältigen)” them
SPEC.linkedContent: PP loses mastery w/ flooding (Überschwemmung), psychic apparatus no longer seeks pleasure, occupied only w/ binding (binden) excitations, w/ “mastering (bewältigen)” them

SPEC.content: tendency to stricturing (binding, mastering) foreshadows PP w/out being it, everything en différance de stricture > repetition itself > but there never is repetition itself > allure of this more or less tightened lace
SPEC.linkedContent: tendency to stricturing (binding, mastering) foreshadows PP w/out being it, everything en différance de stricture > repetition itself > but there never is repetition itself > allure of this more or less tightened lace

SPEC.content: normal repetition: idealizing interiorization, mastery (Hegel, Husserl)
SPEC.linkedContent: normal repetition: idealizing interiorization, mastery (Hegel, Husserl)

SPEC.content: PP, mastery w/ no regional limit, all other mastery (politics, etc.) derived form it
SPEC.linkedContent: PP, mastery w/ no regional limit, all other mastery (politics, etc.) derived form it

SPEC.content: no relève of PP—not Hegelian [since PP always master?] > in fact, function of PP, (postal) binding, determines interpretation of Aufhebung
SPEC.linkedContent: no relève of PP—not Hegelian [since PP always master?] > in fact, function of PP, (postal) binding, determines interpretation of Aufhebung

SPEC.content: the démesure shared by pleasure & unpleasure must be interrupted by PP > PP must weaken both to achieve mastery, takes its profits in moderation
SPEC.linkedContent: the démesure shared by pleasure & unpleasure must be interrupted by PP > PP must weaken both to achieve mastery, takes its profits in moderation

SPEC.content: PP (the master) is not master > pleasure, the great speculator, calculates w/ effects of aphrodisiac stricture (Socrates wanted nothing to do with proper name of Aphrodite)
SPEC.linkedContent: PP (the master) is not master > pleasure, the great speculator, calculates w/ effects of aphrodisiac stricture (Socrates wanted nothing to do with proper name of Aphrodite)

SPEC.content: s’il faut se rendre à ce qu’il faut echaîner strictement [if it’s necessary to submit to what must follow strictly] re: le mot de maîtrise, going beyond oppositional logic—is there mastery?
SPEC.linkedContent: s’il faut se rendre à ce qu’il faut echaîner strictement [if it’s necessary to submit to what must follow strictly] re: le mot de maîtrise, going beyond oppositional logic—is there mastery?

SPEC.content: Bemächtigungstrieb, drive not reduced to other drives, takes place in others, quasi-transcendental privilege, donner, prendre, envoyer, destiner, transcendental tautology
SPEC.linkedContent: Bemächtigungstrieb, drive not reduced to other drives, takes place in others, quasi-transcendental privilege, donner, prendre, envoyer, destiner, transcendental tautology

SPEC.content: drive to dominate: drivenness of drive
SPEC.linkedContent: drive to dominate: drivenness of drive

SPEC.content: Laplanche & Pontalis compare Bemächtigung (power, possession, domination) to Bewältigung (violent exercise of power) > the “posts” are always posts of power (i.e. dynamics of sadism are dynamics of power)
SPEC.linkedContent: Laplanche & Pontalis compare Bemächtigung (power, possession, domination) to Bewältigung (violent exercise of power) > the “posts” are always posts of power (i.e. dynamics of sadism are dynamics of power)

SPEC.content: Freud asks how sadism can be deduced from Eros if it tends to destroy the object
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud asks how sadism can be deduced from Eros if it tends to destroy the object

SPEC.content: auto-heterology of drive for postal power, more originary than, independent of, PP > the only one to permit definition of death drive, an original sadism
SPEC.linkedContent: auto-heterology of drive for postal power, more originary than, independent of, PP > the only one to permit definition of death drive, an original sadism

SPEC.content: beyond the pleasure principle—power: that is, les postes [erection, position & delay]
SPEC.linkedContent: beyond the pleasure principle—power: that is, les postes [erection, position & delay]

FV.content: [proper] address of letter: law that binds King & Queen
there are only ostriches, the more one presents one’s rear, the more one is master: can’t avoid being plucked (laisser plumer)
FV.linkedContent: there are only ostriches, the more one presents one’s rear, the more one is master: can’t avoid being plucked (laisser plumer)
